why.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used to ask or talk about the reason for something
why.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Why do we have to take all these tests?
‘I won’t be able to come into work tomorrow.’ ‘Why not?’
I have no idea why the television isn’t working.
Simon loves you – that’s why he wants to be with you.
He’s angry with me and I don’t know why.
There’s no reason why we shouldn’t be friends.
Why on earth didn’t you ask me to help?
‘I don’t want us to be seen together.’ ‘Why ever not?’
why.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used to introduce a question that shows you do not think it is necessary to do something
why.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: Why worry? You can’t do anything about it.
Why waste time going to the bank when you can do it all over the Internet?
why.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: used when you are surprised or have suddenly realized something
why.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: And I thought to myself, why, I can do that.
